Checklist

Checklist

A checklist pattern for presenting an end to end journey in logical steps.

On this page
  • Visual design
  • Guidelines for use
  • Examples and assets

Visual design

Checklist page layout

The checklist design pattern consists of a list of numbered items and a 'save progress' feature. The items open to reveal sub-items with checkboxes allowing users to track their progress through the list.

Design view:

Mobile design

Desktop designs can be viewed on screens wider than 650px.

Checklist items

Design view:

Mobile design

Desktop designs can be viewed on screens wider than 650px.

Guidelines for use

Purpose

The checklist pattern presents the user with an end to end journey in logical steps and provides links to content on other websites to help them complete each step.

When to use this pattern:

  • For end to end journeys that have a specific start and end point.
  • When the user needs to interact with multiple pieces of content or tools on other government websites.
  • Where it’s helpful for someone to complete tasks in a specific order or when some steps can be completed concurrently.
  • When it’s helpful for someone to have a sense at a high level what’s ahead in a journey.

When not to use this pattern:

  • when the user only needs to read guidance and not take an action (use Guide pattern instead).
  • when there’s no logical or helpful order to complete the tasks, for example, when you’re presenting the user with a series of options.
  • When you are educating the user about a specific stage in an end to end journey (use the tutorial pattern).

Examples and assets

View checklist design and assets in Adobe XD.
